channel.title: Counter-Strike
channel.description:
Hi guys.
Computer Specifications:
Celeron CPU 2.40 GHz 512Mb Ram OnBoard Intel 845G Graphics
The Story....
I play counter-strike 1.5. Not as fps consuming as 1.6 and source. The problem is, i only get around 10 - 40 fps when im playing... but when im in console from main menu it says i get just below 60 fps. When im playing and i move around, i have hellishly looking graphics and i move sooo slow. I can barely get any frags because most of the time i get killed first... and the bare minimum to play counterstrike is if you hit 50 - 60 fps. My friend squeezes in 70+ FPS with an onboard graphics and has a more crappy computer than me...
If anyone can help me, just give me some information or if you have any commands, tips etc... all appreciated!

item.title: Counter-Strike
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

I’m running on a 256mb OnBoard graphics card. My problem isn’t as serious as yours, but it can still get a bit laggy when playing CS. All I reccomend is buying a better graphics card.

Read full topic

item.title: Counter-Strike
item.dc:creator: @robocz033 robocz033
item.description:
@robocz033 wrote:

what os are you using and what other programs are you running while doing this. a good way to see how much computing power a process is taking is doing ctrl + alt + del and click on the processes tab and see which ones are using the most memory. if they dont need to be run, you should close them.

Read full topic
